Note: Tasker *must* be installed before this app and the preference Misc / Allow External Access must be set in Tasker\'s UI.\n\nIf you are having issues with the tasks not firing please uninstall both apps and reinstall Tasker prior to installing Trigger.

Place your device over an NFC tag to begin writing.
You are configuring a secure setting. This requires root access.
This may not have an effect on all devices.
This will open your SMS app with the To and Message fields filled out. To automatically send the message tap this message to download the SMS Plugin from the play store.
This will open the dialer with the number entered. To automatically place a call tap this message to download the Call Plugin from the play store.
close the default activity of an app
This may not work with all apps without root access. Root access will ensure that the process is successfully killed.
All activities may not be launchable.
Once a tag is made read-only you will no longer be able to write to it. This action cannot be undone.

Place the back of the phone over the tag to copy.
Switch tasks contain two separate tasks and toggle between them each time an nfc tag is tapped.\n\nYou can add a second task to use with nfc tags here.

Run a task or switch task when you tap an NFC tag.
Run a task when you connect or disconnect a bluetooth device.
Run a task when you connect to or disconnect from a wifi network.
Bluetooth must be enabled to list paired devices.
Wifi must be enabled to list saved networks.
Shows your most recent task and lets you launch tasks directly from DashClock
No tasks were found. Do you want to create a new task using this tag?
Run a task when your battery reaches a specific percentage.
Run a task at a specific time on one or more days.

We\'re motivated to make Trigger as useful as we possibly can for you. Your feedback helps us achieve that. Feel free to reach out to us with any issues, comments, or suggestions that you might have using the resources below.
Use your phone\'s sensors to automatically change settings, launch apps or send messages.\n\nGet started with our examples below or create your own tasks.
For any questions or issues with Geofence tasks please click to see our FAQ.
%1$s has no actions.\n\nGo back to add actions or continue to save this task with no actions.

This will allow the Call action to place a call directly rather than open the dialer with the number pre-populated.
This allows the Text Message action to automatically send a text message rather than pre-populate the SMS data in your text message app.
Run a task when you connect or disconnect a wired or wireless charger.
a group of ACTIONS activated by TRIGGERS

When my battery gets low, turn off wifi and lower screen brightness.
Due to the volatility of Google Play Services this is currently a Beta trigger. For many it works well, but we cannot guarantee it will always work.
Upgrading will unlock all triggers and functions of Trigger as well as support ongoing development.

Receive discounts and important updates via email.

silences incoming notifications while you sleep

turns off wifi and turns down screen brightness
turns off wifi and opens Google Maps when driving
Run Battery saver when the battery goes below
Try a 7 day free trial of Trigger PRO.
Battery and Charging triggers will use a foreground service. This will show an ongoing notification but will prevent the OS from killing the service required to monitor these events.
Battery and Charging triggers may not fire if the service is killed by the OS or the app is removed from the recent apps list.
Click here to see a quick tutorial on what tasks are and how to create them.
"Thanks for using Trigger! Download Connect now and start running Trigger Tasks from the web!! (3 day free trial included)"
If you feel urge, good ratings and +1s are always appreciated:

This allows the actual underlying lock screen settings to be changed. Disabling the lock screen will set it to slide. Enabling will either set Pin or Password based on what has been configured.
This may require root access to function properly.
Run a task manually from within the app or from the widget.
Use Activity Detection to start a task. This will impact battery life. You can control sensitivity in the app settings.
After saving you\'ll need to run this task manually.
You\'ll be able to write this task to one or more NFC tags when you finish creating the task.
Run a task when a matching notification is received.
